comments.value:
Can you please look at all of this and make sure it's sensible and fairly easy to achieve? Liz Goulding New Media Producer London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 www.london2012.com www.twitter.com/london2012 -----Original Message----- From: Martin Edwards [mailto:martined@cogapp.com] Sent: 31 March 2010 16:48 To: Liz Goulding Cc: Rachael Rainbow; Jamie Unwin Subject: Success! We now have one solution for ANY domain. Hi Liz, I just tested one new solution and it worked first time, with the added bonus that it's all much simpler as well. No PHP needed. 2 files are attached: - links-list.js: Liz, this is the JSON formatted file where you will be managing the links, please take a look and let me know if it makes sense. The # should be replaced with the microsite link. - theming.js: Jamie, Check the "Some techie info for Jamie" section below for the changes I've made to this file. So: - The JavaScript calls a file on another domain. - This cross domain file is the JSON content (which you will need to edit to add the drop down menu links) wrapped in a *JavaScript function. - Once the cross domain file is returned, our local JavaScript uses its JSON content to populate the HTML drop down. Job done! I hope that makes sense. *For some reason calling the JSON content didn't work cross domain, but calling a JavaScript function does. So we simply wrap the JSON in a JavaScript function Some techie info for Jamie. The microsite content I delivered contained this code below (which linked to a PHP script): $.getJSON("../includes/cross-domain.php", function(data){ $.each(data.links.link, function(){ $("div.drop-down ul").append('
  • ' + $(this).attr("name") + '
    • '); }); }); That should be changed to this one line (replacing the URL with the final LOCOG location): $.getJSON("http://www.cogapp.com/temp/locog/json/links-list.js?callback= ?"); In the cross domain JavaScript file (attached) you'll see we've wrapped the JSON content in a JavaScript function "linkData":

Liz,

Do you want us to put the header live then?

Jamie

Can I see it first? And have you managed to integrate the new xml file,
etc?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

www.twitter.com/london2012

I've started working on it - will let you know when it's in preview, should by end of play today.

Liz,

We're trying to figure out what's the best way to implement cogapps idea, it looks hopeful. But to move forward, we'd need the current list of site names + urls we want to show. Can you please confirm / fill the urls?

Shop
http://www.london2012.com/shop/

Tickets
http://www.tickets.london2012.com/

Torch relay
Mascot
Get Set
Volunteering
My2012

Many thanks.

Well, I think we only have those two and Get Set right now!
(getset.london2012.com) We *will* have mascot in 5 weeks or so - maybe
we should actually hold off launching this until then. I don't actually
know what the url of that is yet (it's still TBD but I'll let you know
asap)

 

That said, isn't it going to be quite easy for me to just go in and
add/change urls as/when the come on board?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Liz,

It's on preview http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/index.php - we could as well hide it for five weeks, but probably it's easier to show the functionality. Can you please confirm if/when it can go live?

> That said, isn't it going to be quite easy for me to just go in and add/change urls as/when the come on board?
We can do two things -
a) have a javascript file as cogapp laid out - it would mean we'd have to upload a new sites.js each time we're changing the menu. I'm not sure how often are we planning to change, if that's once a month or less often, it's a perfectly working solution.

b) have a 'did you know'-like interface in the page editor (so all you have to do is edit the links and titles it in the cms). This would turn into a javascript file as published. This solution involves a bit of extra work, half a day, day, so probably has to be authorised.

I think it should go live in line with the mascot launching - mid mad.
Is that ok?

 

We would definitely only want to change it once a month or less. Once
we've got the main sites up there, we won't need to maintain regularly

 

Is it possible for me to change the javascript file myself? Or will it
need to go through you? And if it does go through you, how much time
will it take (presumably like 15 mins?). Probably not worth the 'did
you know' style interface...

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Liz,

just to answer your question about javascript:

It's probably not a good idea for you to update the javascript and certainly not without testing it on dev first--unless you really want to take responsibility for this sort of thing. I think your estimate or 15 mins to update the file is plausible, although we would almost certainly want to allow more time given that we will want to implement and test it on dev first before doing the same on live. It's probably not worth an interface, I think (although if you were changing it every other week, there might be a case for it...).

I've set this to pending, awaiting confirmation of a date for putting this live.

Mascot is launching the evening of the 19th. So ideally we put it live that evening, but given we've only just confirmed the evening launch, if it's not something you can commit to, then first thing on the 20th.

Also, we will be putting this dropdown on the mascot site, so I think there is a central file that will need to be updated so that the mascot site has access to it. I can get Cogapp to explain further, but I *think* MArtin sent Jamie an email on this a month or 6 weeks back. Can you confirm?


 _____

Liz, I can confirm we can produce a js file, given we've got confirmation for the following two things:

- from Liz: the items we want to put the drop-down menu, in the correct order (currently: shop, tickets, get set - I guess mascot should be added and not entirely sure how one gets back from the mascot site to the main 2012 site, so probably "main site", "shop", "tickets", "get set", "mascot")

- from cogapp, a confirmation that this is the jsonp format that they want: http://www.cogapp.com/temp/locog/json/links-list.js and if they're happy with a FIXED (linkData) callback function. It'll probably sit on http://www.london2012.com/js/linkdata.js - nothing there yet at the moment, but will put a file there in an hour.
Liz,  http://www.london2012.com/js/linkdata.js is there, i hope cogapp can get back if they're happy with it.
Marking as solved

comments.value: Required for testing mid-May.

Hi Morag/Liz,

Haven't heard anything back from McCann on this?

Do you have a spec / date for delivery of designs?

thanks

Jamie

Sorry for not updating you on this before now. We are at design stage and it would be timely to have a call with you to share the designs with you and discuss implementation and timelines. The drop-dead date for having the populated pages ready for testing is 8 June, so we need to work back from that. Will try to put a time in the diary this week for a call / meeting with McCann. Thanks!
Just putting a comment on this to push it to the top of our radar (I know Jamie and Morag have already been discussing it).
Liz, The date on this needs to be rescheduled. Can we discuss?
Morag is the one to speak to here.

Concerned that the date for this is being pushed back, as this is a very firm deadline for us. Can we discuss the order in which we handle these templates so we can get the content into the site in time? Also, can you confirm the date you think you are working to? Mid-May (at the top of the ticket) is not the actual date - we need to have the site up and populated and running on the staging environment by 7 June - so there is possibly more time, although that eats into the time we have available to add content. Let's discuss today in our catch-up.
Discussed. Date for delivery now changed to May 31st.
We are currently looking at about 20 days for this, not including registration work (separate ticket)
Thanks for this – it sounds in order. Please note: a separate PO will be provided for this piece of work so please keep separate from the retainer.
We have marked this as solved (i.e. editorial handover). We can open new tickets for new issues or additional work.
Perfect – thanks!

Hello

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator. 

Consequently we need to update the Contact us page so that any public enquiries directed to LOCOG will be forwarded directly to info@enquiries.london2012.com instead of enquiries@london2012.com 

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!
Priority changed to "urgent".

Hi Morag,

Have updated, but for future reference you can do it here yourself, may need to republish contact page after saving.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/emailContacts

Jamie

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!

Integrate Facebook friends feed/widget and latest posts into Volunteering site.

See Lars for where it goes, ask Jamie how it works.

http://dev.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/volunteer/about/index.php 

Did some research. It's two part job:

1. On the left side, a list of thumbnails of fans/members. There are two solutions for this, one is putting in an iframe with the facebook widget (same as what we're seeing on the vancouver site), which doesn't look very nice, but -very- easy to implement, so easy it's already installed on preview. The other solution would be to query the facebook API and generate a markup based on that. Based on the research, it's much harder than expected (there doesn't seem to be a way to get the list of fans of a page, which would be essential for this one - so we'd need to hack something, which may have a questionable reliability), probably a week or more.

2. on the right side, there's a social wall - I'm not sure if it's decided yet wether we put facebook page wall or twitter feed to it, but both should be relatively straightforward as we did both in the young leaders page - just some css/alignment work here. But: we need to know which one to put in.

And to make this progress really quickly, we need to know the url of the Facebook page we're integrating. I'm seeing a couple of 2012 volunteering -groups-, which are v similar to pages, but may have some api limitations.
Looks good !

As discussed (briefly) this morning, we need to start preparing for the eventual move of Kitsite CMS servers to BT's hosting environment later this year.

danny
To clarify: the immediate issue is whether and how it might make sense to introduce a staging server into the production environment (subject of ticket amended).
possibly a staging server for js and css and on an ad hoc basis for big changes.

Once Huw has it in place we'll need (at least) to:

- setup server as per web01
- allow access from Kitsite office / dev / milo etc. to new staging server (SSH/SFTP/HTTP/HTTPS etc.)
- turn off CMS publication
- run manual RSYNC from web01 --> to -> new staging srever
- disable  RSYNC script (on web01)
- copy current RSYNC script (on web01) to new staging machine and add a rule for web01 (question over who does this us or BT; as up till now it has been BT responsibility); new script should now sync from [ staging --> to -> web01-06 ]
- change above RSYNC to exclude .css and .js files.
- change CMS publication target to to new staging server / turn on publication
- Kitsite to check LUCKIT/Network/SMTP access (and anything else on K's sever sanity checklist)
- BT to possibly make changes if problems discovered above
- Kitsite to create a separate RSYNC script that only syncs CSS and JS files
- Document process to use above file.

Have just followed up direct with Jagdeep on this as well..

--

Hi Jagdeep,

I am waiting on confirmation form Morag but the Volunteering site is part of the main www.london2012.com site and lives in the main CMS instance.

It will live under /get-involved/volunteer (or /get-involved/volunteering) TBD

Therefore the server is identical to web01

--

The following is how I was imagining we we're planning to use the 'staging' server in the current environment:

- New server set up to act as if it was a new instance of (web01-06) lets call call it web00. (or staging.) as it will now become the first in the chain.
- Access to this server is only allowed to specific IP addresses (it is not part of the load balanced servers) *
- CMS publication is stopped
- The rsync scripts are moved from web01 to web00 (staging)
- We manually sync web01 to web00 (so that web00 has a full copy of the site)
- CMS publication is changed so that we now publish to web00 (staging)

We can then decide which content is automatically synced from web00 (staging) to web01-06; we can either stop any automatic syncing ie. when making a major site change, syncing of a section of a site (for launching a new section **) or just limit the auto syncing of CSS/JS (which we sync manually)

Does that sound similar to how you we're imaging it being used?

* we already have the 'direct access' to web01 which we access via SSH to 213.120.228.198 (rather than going via the load balancer 213.120.228.200) / yes we need root (or ss -) access, although we currently have this on on web01 / in effect we need a clone of web01 / the same access rights (server and firewall) as we have to web01

** although we can limit the automatic syncing of a given section or pages ie. /get-involved/volunteering we cannot stop pages outside of this section (which have been synced) from trying to link to new pages within this section. For example if we have a new page called /get-involved/volunteering/new.php then until we push that page out onto the live site, links to that page from pages outside of the /get-involved/volunteering section will result in a 404. We may be able to limit this using redirects. I think we probably need to look at this on a case by case basis, depending on exactly what we are trying to deploy.

* These are the machines / routers / IP's that currently have access to web01 (we need the same level of firewall access to the new server)
94.193.102.181 (kitsite office router)
89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.113 (dev.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.117 (koala.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.120 (roo.kitsite.com)

Jamie

On 26 May 2010, at 17:47, Jagdeep Bhambra wrote:

Jamie

I’m working with BT to scope out the Staging environment – this will also be used to host the volunteering site (which I believe you’re working on).

Could you let me know the following:
a)       How is the site structured – html, PhP, flash? Etc
b)       Access needed – sudo? Root?
c)       Environment needed  - eg, Apache? Tomcat? PhP/core modules? Additional?
d)       Connectivity – ssh preferable
e)       Who needs visibility of the site – LOCOG/KitSite – may need to inform BT with regards to firewall rules... (input from Morag/Huw?)

If you could let me know by COP today or tomorrow morning at the latest – the meeting with BT is tomorrow afternoon

Our photos on the venues pages don't seem to be appearing in the right
order.

Can you look into? They should be most recent first when you do a
search...

 

Thanks

 

Alex

http://www.london2012.com/photos/search.php?sport=Cycling&paralympic=Cyc
ling&venue=Velodrome&tag=velodrome&related=true&start=1

 

Alexandra Brown

Marketing Executive (New Media)

Communications

 

Olympic Delivery Authority

Mailpoint: 7A

23rd Floor, One Churchill Place

London E14 5LN

 

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001

www.london2012.com  

 

 

Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com

Searches come back grouped by day, week, month, year (or something 
like that)

But they don't come back in true 'date order' as what you are doing 
where you do a free text search is searching for 'likeness'

Is a page that is an exact match but is from last week less relevant 
than one published yesterday that just happens to have a similar title.

Tags on the other hand /should be/ in date order as you can either 
match a single tag or not match a single tag, their is no fuzzzyness.

Hi Alex,

We're looking at it in IE6 and it looks fine (actually the line is is bit off)

Do you see the same problem on all the images ?

Also is it just when the pages loads (or once the page has loaded) ?

The way that line / slope is handled is done differently for IE6, where in IE7/IE8/Firefox etc. it's just done by overlaying a logo with a transparent background. In IE6 it's done with some Javascript which may be why it doesn't appear till the page has fully loaded (and if the page doesn't fully load for some reason it may not work at all).

Jamie

Hi

 

I will need to check this next week when I’m on a computer with IE6.

 

Thanks


Alex
